RelatedSentence: Tingyi Cayman Islands Holding Corp ( 0322 ) , China 's largest food and beverage maker by sales , reported a 22.4 percent rise in first - quarter net profit from a year back .
Lower input prices helped drive growth in instant noodle and beverage sales , it said .

Net profit rose to US$ 128.4 million ( HK $ 1.01 billion ) from US$ 104.9 million a year earlier , the Taiwan - based company said yesterday .
Tingyi , which has a broad - ranging partnership with PepsiCo , sells noodles under the Master Kong brand in China .

Tingyi said revenue for the first quarter was US$ 2.8 billion , up 5 percent from US$ 2.6 billion a year ago .
